page.title: 03Social Development
page.content: A survey of 12 yr. old pupils revealed the following features about the development of the{community.}The vast majority, about 85%, were born locally: most at St.Margaret's Hospital, Epping, and a few at home or in Harlow.{Parents}generally were born in the East End of London with a smaller proportion from North London. {Grandparents}were drawn from a much wider area, but with a prepoderance from the London region. This migration over three generations, suggests increasing{affluence}coupled with accessibility to London, and the surviving connection, albeit now tenuous, with the East End.All replies noted the development of supermarkets, and a significant number noted the library/swimming pool complex. Local celebrities again reflect affluence and the proximity to London.
